alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 5:02PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Randolph and northeastern Pocahontas Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 502 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles north of Snowshoe, or 12 miles northwest of Cass Scenic Railroad, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mingo, Durbin, Valley Head, Cheat Bridge, and Bartow. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for northeastern West Virginia.
